title: The Man, the snake and the fox
creator_credit: Tony Snowsill and National Film Board of Canada
brief_description: This film is a dramatization of a traditional Ojibwa legend; it is told to a group of children from the Wandereing Spirit Survival School. As the story unfolds, the characters played by puppets assume increasingly human characteristics. The moral of the fable: do not make promises that cannot be kept.
